sentences.en: At the tender age of seventeen I left home.
sentences.cn: 早在十七岁的小小年纪,我就离开了家.

sentences.en: Continue cooking until the meat is tender.
sentences.cn: 把肉一直烧到松软为止。

sentences.en: Cost control of the project is that the cost management starts from the construction tender price until the completion of the project, throughout the total implementation of the project.
sentences.cn: 工程项目的成本控制指的是施工成本管理应从工程投标标价开始，直至项目竣工结算完成为止，贯穿项目实施的总工程。

sentences.en: He felt a sudden tender pity for her.
sentences.cn: 他突然涌起一股对她的温柔怜悯之情。

sentences.en: If the meat is marbled with fat it should be tender.
sentences.cn: 如果是五花肉的话，应该比较嫩。

sentences.en: It is a beautiful meat, very lean and tender.
My skin was abraded and very tender.
Steam or microwave the vegetables until tender.
sentences.cn: 蒸或者用微波炉加热蔬菜，直至蔬菜变软。

sentences.en: Steam the carrots until they are just beginning to be tender.
sentences.cn: 将胡萝卜蒸至刚好变软。

sentences.en: The meat was tender and juicy.
The staff are forbidden to tender for private-sector work.
sentences.cn: 工作人员不得投标承接私营部门的工作。

sentences.en: They are going to tender for the construction of a new motorway.
sentences.cn: 他们打算投标承建一条新的高速公路.

sentences.en: they have abandoned their children to the tender mercies of the social services.
sentences.cn: 他们遗弃了孩子，任其在社会福利中听天由命。

sentences.en: To reconstitute dried tomatoes, simmer in plain water until they are tender.
sentences.cn: 要泡开西红柿干，需要将其放在清水中用文火炖，直到它们变软。

sentences.en: Treat any tender points by massaging.
sentences.cn: 用按摩法治疗疼痛部位。

sentences.en: We were both very tender and passionate towards one another.
sentences.cn: 我们相亲相爱，如胶似漆。

sentences.en: Young haricot beans have a tender texture and a delicate, subtle flavour.
sentences.cn: 嫩菜豆口感细腻，味道清香、淡雅。

words.tran_cn: 亲切；柔软；柔和；敏感；棘手
温柔的；柔软的；脆弱的；幼稚的；难对付的
提供，偿还；使…变嫩；是…变柔软

phrases.tran_cn: 亲切照料；细心看护；（英）（对病入膏肓的老年患者停止积极治疗的）安乐护理

trans.tran_cn: 纤弱的，嫩的，温柔的，疼痛的
trans.tran_en: tender food is easy to cut and eat, especially because it has been well cooked

trans.tran_cn: （正式）提出，投标，供应船，联络船，照看者
trans.tran_en: a formal statement of the price you would charge for doing a job or providing goods or services

trans.tran_cn: 提供，偿还；使…变嫩；使…变柔软
trans.tran_en: to make a formal offer to do a job or provide goods or services for a particular price
to make a formal offer to do a job or provide goods or services for a particular price

trans.tran_cn: 正式提出，使变脆弱，<古>温柔地对待
trans.tran_en: to formally offer or show something to someone
